website_summaries.verdict: With the latest firmware update, the D-Link DIR-655 is arguably one of the best among single-band Wireless-N routers on the market.
pros: The D-Link DIR-655 offers decent throughput performance and stable wireless signal
The router has an intuitive and responsive Web interface, support for Gigabit Ethernet and guest networking, and an extensive set of networking features
cons: The DIR-655 doesn't have dual-band support
Its SharePort USB port can work with only one computer at a time

website_summaries.verdict: This fast wireless router comes with Gigabit LAN ports and has many features, including QoS monitoring, but the complex interface may intimidate some.
pros: Fast (thanks to Gigabit Ethernet LAN ports) and feature-rich

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to get better range and a piddly single-band netgear WNR2020 I have in the basement works better. The router never really worked as well as it should have for the price point. And has gotten to the point after a couple of years of requiring rebooting almost every day. It either drops wireless, drops internet throughput, or both. And the front panel lights don't say anything is wrong. NO FIRMWARE UPDATES SINCE 2011.
customer_reviews.author: Sarcasmo

customer_reviews.title: Expect a speed reduction
customer_reviews.text: While it delivers most of the speed, it does significantly throttle the gigabit internet you could be getting without it. The wireless works great for what it is and the range is decent enough but I am really disappointed in the speeds coming out of the ethernet cables. Less that 20% of the speeds I was getting when I just had the same cable hooked up directly to the jack. Keeping in mind I only have two devices hooked up to the router, my laptop and my PS4 and somehow the PS4 is getting greater speeds, almost half of the original speeds I was getting initially without the router.
customer_reviews.author: CWL

customer_reviews.title: What?!Good Stuffz
customer_reviews.text: works great. Got it refurb'd but still has no problems. not very good at penetrating walls, but I am talking two walls, bathroom cabinet, and a tub. I can see it. Just not really connect to it. Would be great as long as you have line of sight of it. Large room or something. If you have many smaller rooms, you should get a few smaller ones and make them all say the same name. Gooooooooooooooogllllllllllllllllllllllllleeee Configuring two wireless routers with one ssid and you should be set but if you are in a studio or something where you don't have many walls your devices will need to go through (two tops), than this router is more than enough.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: 8 years old!
customer_reviews.text: I came back to my purchase to find out what ghz it is. It isnt on the unit or the manual. I am buying a wireless outdoor security camera to use with it and it only works with 2.4. This is a great router although there havent been hardware updates for years. Does anyone know if its a 2.4 or 5 ghz?
customer_reviews.author: Susan K Blakey

customer_reviews.title: This thing has lasted!
customer_reviews.text: The DIR-655 was a great purchase. Set up was easy and I am still using it today, June 9, 2020. Currently I use it to send wireless signals to 2 smart phones, 2 tablets, 3 ROKU devices, 3 TV's, 1 Android box, 1 laptop, and 1 PC. I would say that it has stood the test of time!
customer_reviews.author: Tony Mangone

customer_reviews.title: Good router for home/personal use.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item on 16 August. It worked very well and I was pleased with it's options and menus. The setup was pretty easy as well. Then it died on 12 October. Fortunately that left me 4 days to have Amazon replace it, which they have done. Amazon sent out a replacement right away. Will update later. **Jan 2020 update, this router is still working exactly as it should, it seems the failure of the first one was a fluke. I have had this router long enough to find that it an intermittent problem with streaming 480p video to my living room. I have had to seek an alternative. Would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Work's Great, The Best In It's Class
customer_reviews.text: Work's Great, The Best In It's Class.This is an award winning router that was built for high end professionals, gamers, streamers, downloading video etc. It's 2.4ghz without 5 ghz, that most of this planet can do without! No problems at all, no hype, best router yet. Internet Providers, Manufacturers have pushed most people into 5ghz, have you noticed since they came out, most had bad reviews and are donated everywhere or thrown out. Look at what your provider is giving to you for speeds, etc. this router is ahead of it's time and they know it!
customer_reviews.author: votedemocrat

customer_reviews.title: Works great with Comcast!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this easy on the wallet router to use with my Comcast provider and paired it up with the ARRIS / Motorola SurfBoard SB6141 DOCSIS 3.0 Cable Modem that I purchased at a good price at Costco. My Internet is now at an officially crazy blazing speed as a result! I normally watch long YouTube videos (TV shows) at 1080p and the buffering speed is insanely fast. My Comcast service is Blast! and this setup definitely is a great configuration to get as much out of your service (from what technical info I know) as possible. Plus, the router looks great!
customer_reviews.author: A. Consumer

customer_reviews.title: This router was really good for about a month
customer_reviews.text: This router was really good for about a month. The internet download and upload speed (using Ookla Speedtest) was about 100% faster than using the standard router/modem combo supplied by Cox. So it was worth it, at first. Then it just started dropping connections about once a week, and required rebooting and reconfiguring. The tech support at Dlink doesn't exist, so I had no idea how to fix the issues. Updating firmware did nothing, power cycling did nothing. It still starts a state of constant connection drops about once a week, and sometimes more often.
customer_reviews.author: Joey Ramos

customer_reviews.title: I haven't had problems with this router, and it ...
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had problems with this router, and it is going strong even five years after I bought it. I have played with a few things such as port forwarding with webcams and remotely shutting down wi-fi. All have worked well for me. Perhaps I am just lucky. I don't experience the variety of problems that others have reported. I called D-Link tech support years ago about this router once. The support staff was not particularly helpful, but overall, this router has been working for me. No degrading in the wi-fi. I also don't notice dropped connections attributed to the router; they have more to do with my ISP.
customer_reviews.author: AppleSaucy

customer_reviews.title: Best technology
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on a timely basis, good packaging, easy setup. Easy setup. This router is the best one I have used so far. Great range. Installed it in my living room, took my laptop into the farthest bedroom, went into the closet and closed the door and connected immediately to my home network. Installed my network printer in seconds. My upload and download speeds have increased 200% to 500%. I am absolutely impressed with the quality of this product and the price. Would highly recommend this device to serious home network users. Too bad I don't need another one.
customer_reviews.author: padooka

customer_reviews.title: Very good router
customer_reviews.text: For years, I bought Linksys routers, in part because of their good marketing. But they were plagued by dropouts, poor performance, etc. When my last router needed replacing, I searched to find what was on sale. I spotted this D-Link and thought I'd give it a try. I am very happy with my purchase. Everything in my house -- computer, television, Roku box, Apple TV, Samsung tablet, laptop, iPod -- connects with it beautifully. The signal is very strong, and carries clear across my large back yard. I have had one of these routers for more than a year now, and liked it so much that I purchased one for my girlfriend. She's equally happy with hers.
customer_reviews.author: cameraz

customer_reviews.title: Stronger Signal...Great For Replacing Wireless b or g
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one of these. My first one was "On" 24/7 for about a year and a half before the power supply module stopped working. I tried a Universal Power Supply to see if the router was still working but couldn't get a wireless signal. Setup, using the disk that comes with the router, is very easy and will even save all of your settings and passwords to a file on your desktop, which you can move to a flash drive or print out for future reference. Adding additional computers, cell phones, ipads, etc. is also easy using the instructions provided.
customer_reviews.author: JW

customer_reviews.title: Seems to have a weak signal
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to provide a stronger wireless signal on the opposite side of our house that has a standard Comcast gateway / modem. The Comcast modem is located in the basement at one end of a colonial. The D-Link was placed on the 1st floor at the other end of the house. Peculiarly, a laptop and 2 android phones show the Comcast signal stronger than the D-Link when at the center of the 1st floor, whereas one would expect the closer D-Link signal to be stronger. However, I have not time the transfer speeds, so it could be a moot point. Maybe will have a chance to post an update with the transfer speed.
customer_reviews.author: Brent J Maranzano

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy from this seller and do not buy this router.
customer_reviews.text: Not too excited about this. Quite a challenge to configure. Numerous issues and not working. Update: After 4 times on customer support with D-Link, the item is still not working and the seller will not return. He told me that his one month window to return was up. After making the mistake to initially take their advice and call D-Link Support- they could not even fix this. Terrible customer service and they don't stand by their product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My 2 cents. I bought this router October 2009 ...
customer_reviews.text: My 2 cents. I bought this router October 2009 and it's still working. This was made before the time when multiple devices would be pushing data. Playstation, Xbox, and Mobile Phones were barely out of the gate and streaming music was still a dream. I'm surprised it keeps up as well as it does, all things considered. Connection drops occasionally but I'm not certain it's this device. Not ready for the bone yard yet!
customer_reviews.author: BRUCEB

customer_reviews.title: Stability problems.
customer_reviews.text: This has been my latest waste of money in a long line of 802.11n routers that just don't work. Some overheat and crash, others (inexplicably) don't support UPnP, and then there's the DIR-655: every hour or two of moderate use, the network cuts out, and nothing but rebooting the router causes it to come back. It's not overheating - it doesn't even feel warm. The network just vanishes, interrupting the movie, game, file transfer, or whatever I'm doing at the time. And since it's using the latest firmware, the problem can't be solved with a simple firmware upgrade. Save yourself a headache - look elsewhere. This thing's less-than-impressive feature set isn't worth the stability problems.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Router--especially for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using the N+300 for about 2 months now. I replaced a much more expensive Linksys EA6500 dual band (cost 4X as much) with the DLink, and it is far more reliable and out-performs the Linksys in signal strength throughout the house. We use up to 5 devices at a time--including streaming Netflix and TMobil wireless phone service. It all works great! Not one problem so far. Would give it 5 stars, except that I would recommend dual-band, and will probably upgrade later. Initially, I bought this as a back up to the Linksys, but it is way better, so I may just later get a DLink dual-band.
customer_reviews.author: Tom S

customer_reviews.title: Nothing Special
customer_reviews.text: The wireless portion of the router just gave out after two years of below average use. Overall, it was a good router, when it was working. I am not a very heavy user of wireless networking. Used the router for basic office connectivity and surfing the web and streaming video to multiple devices simultaneously. I do not know what the longevity of a router is suppose to be but I would have thought more than 2 years. For example, my cable modem is about 8 years old and still going strong. Lastly, the LED lights on the router are quite bright. Thus, I do not think that it can be kept in a bedroom unless the lights are covered.
customer_reviews.author: reefguy

customer_reviews.title: Like the control- but
customer_reviews.text: I order this because I have Comcast and their rental wireless router had to be controlled (software and firewall) by them and it had a second wireless network that you could not connect too - it was for "their purposes only" - I don't like that. So I got this. Love the security side, love the interface, easy to set up - but - the wireless is kind of slow and the QoS is difficult to set up. Very happy with firewall and security though. And no I'm not wearing a tinfoil hat - look into xfinity's new wireless routers and the complaints.
customer_reviews.author: JD-- Minneapolis, MN

customer_reviews.title: Sorry I bought this
customer_reviews.text: I tried a Medalink router. It had no range and was slow. Purchased D-Link DIR 655 Router. It was exactly as advertised. Had it set up and running in 5 minutes using their instructions. I'm sitting outside on my back patio writing this and have plenty of range to stay on the Internet...excellent product. Update: This product fails to work properly. Have talked to D Link people on several occasions. They are extremely courteous on the phone. After router is reset it works right for a while then fails again. Always having to unplug router and reset it. Drops to 2 MB down when I have 30. Sorry I bought this.
customer_reviews.author: Judge

customer_reviews.title: Two years later it still works great
customer_reviews.text: When the number of wi-fi enabled electronics increased in my household I decided to buy a better wireless router. The signal has a pretty far reach extending to my front yard which I find impressive seeing the router sits underground in my basement at the back end of the house. The signal is reliable and not noticeably slower than when the connection is hardwired. Streaming video works great, but I still try to hardwire to those devices as it's bandwidth demanding. A nice, small feature is that when the power goes out I don't recall ever needing to reset it, unlike every router I've ever had. No complaints here.
customer_reviews.author: A Human Becoming

customer_reviews.title: Great Router
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic router. I have one of these already in use and after 4 or so years its starting to act goofy so I bought another one to replace my current one when or if it bugs out. The speeds are fantastic and it pretty much covers my whole house from the lower level office. I am an avid gamer and use wireless on my pc to game online and never have any connection or latency issues. I would suggest spending the few extra dollars on this one over one of the cheaper ones if you can afford it. Even though this router has been around for awhile it's still a great choice!
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: Always use D-link for fast 'net
customer_reviews.text: Been using d-link for all my high speed internet access since I first had dsl, then switched over to cable. They're easy to setup, easy to use and no complications along the way. I've had other brands and find they aren't as simple to setup and use, aka they feel like they were created for network engineers, not the home user that it was intended for. The dvd that comes with this walks you through setting it up including passwording the network, installing the 3 antennae and hooking up devices. I get a strong signal across the house and wirelessly on my android phone from a much better distance than the router this one replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Mat

customer_reviews.title: did not work even after hours on the phone
customer_reviews.text: I bought it to be a router and print server. The router function worked. The print server did not work. I spent hours on the phone with tech support. Twice, they asked me to "rest" my hardware. I'm not joking. It sure sounded like an excuse just to get me off the phone. At the end, they offered an RMA. Among the things I had to do was install new firmware and a new version of the print server software. None of this worked and was an enormous waste of time and energy. Their software would just hang up, blinking and doing nothing, endlessly. I will never buy another Dlink product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I expected has longer range signal from this router
customer_reviews.text: I bought this router because it has 3 antenna. It is easy to setup and it has usb port to connect usb printer. The firmware from the programmer wrote is ok because it doesn't hang even it is overload. the only issue i have is the living room smart TV not connected to it too well. I don't think the distance has more than 20 feets tho and my internet speed has 30mbs. I think i will run the cable for those bad reception instead. Since i bought this around 70 dollars for this, I think this router is overpriced even i bought it on sale. I think it worthy around 50 dollars maximum
customer_reviews.author: Cutelover

customer_reviews.title: Shareport doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: The router works ok, used it for surfing the internet only and even then it had moments of lag and web pages would sit and load for a long time periodically. The shareport feature never worked even after I tried to add it to the list of approved devices on my firewall settings. Customer support is a separate company from D-Link and wants you to pay money for any help offered. That was the deal breaker. My suggestion and next router, Airport Express (maybe Airport Extreme). Can print from both PC and Mac without relying on some bogus software that supposedly switches user control of the USB port (I'm sure that'll work reliably every time...)
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Wireless signal a bit weak
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded from Linksys G to this one primarily for the N and Gigabit ports. Manual setup is easy enough. I kept the SSID and security the same as before, all devices on my network work just fine including PS3, Macs, Blu-ray players, PC etc.. Except the wireless signal seems weaker than the Linksys G router. The placement location is same as before. iPhone went from 3 bars to 1-2 bars. Works but weaker. Same goes for the signal strength meter on the Thinkpad. My wireless printer works fine, so that's good. May be D-Link makes a signal booster? The antenna extension is a joke. 4 feet that's all !? They really should make the extension powered with a 25' cable.
customer_reviews.author: R. Wong

customer_reviews.title: Quits Working
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these and after about 12 months the wireless quit working. I was pretty happy up until that point and needed another router so I bought another DIR-655. After 2 months this new one would lose all connection expectantly (like I would expect it in the first place). It would "reset" itself and after a few minutes it would lose all connection again. I'd unplug and plug it back in, which would get me about 5 minutes of connection time before the router would cr4pped out again. To be fair, I never tried contacting Customer Support to see if they'd "fix" the problem as I need a working connection right now because my son does home schooling.
customer_reviews.author: G. S.

customer_reviews.title: Not easy to setup in Win 7
customer_reviews.text: For some reason this wasn't easy to setup. I think Win 7 is to blame but who knows. At any rate after getting it up and running it works great. Better coverage and slightly faster than my old Linksys 54G. I couldn't get my printer to work with the USB SharePort feature though. I could print MS Office documents but not from IE or Chrome. UPDATE: 7/23/2012 I recently purchased an Apple Airport Express for wireless iTunes streaming to another room. After a lot of trial and error I can't get it to work with the D-Link. Upon further research apparently Dlink and Apple neworking products don't work together. That's a shame.
customer_reviews.author: W. Sopchek

customer_reviews.title: All the features I expected, easy enough to use.
customer_reviews.text: This router works as advertised. I'm by far no computer genius and I know just enough about advanced settings in routers to be dangerous, but this thing was a breeze to set up. The security was easy to set up. I have never had to reset the router because it was acting funky. I was able to have one XBox hooked up wirelessly playing Black Ops multiplayer, another hooked up via hardwire playing Black Ops multiplayer, my laptop connected wirelessly playing Pandora, and my phone connected via wifi, all at the same time (and more times than not my buddy and I were hosting the Black Ops multiplayer matches!). I recommend this router.
customer_reviews.author: BeefyJay

customer_reviews.title: So happy i bought this
customer_reviews.text: This router is a great buy. I was using an old Cisco-Linksys router that was terrible. Everyday I would have to reset it. Constantly have family members yelling at me "RESET IT!!" cause they're on the laptop downstairs and the internet wasnt working. I bought this router and have not had one single issue. Internet is snappier, and now i never have to reset it. My phone never connected to our wifi well.. unless i reset it so i just never connected it. Now i get home, turn on my wifi and i'm connected within seconds. i love this thing. Stop thinking about getting it, just get it!
customer_reviews.author: Kb

customer_reviews.title: Lasted in my office for 5 years and never gave me a problem
customer_reviews.text: I just now went to see when I purchased this router here on Amazon...I thought I'd had it for 2-3 years. I bought it in January 2009! This thing was great. It did get a bit warm as others have mentioned but it never caused an issue. I'm only writing this review now because a storm we had just killed it and I'm shopping for a new one. If a router gives me 5 years of excellent service, it deserves 5 stars. I'm going to see what's out there but I'll probably be buying another one to replace the one that got fried.
customer_reviews.author: Rhetoric

customer_reviews.title: Bad unit, bad customer support
customer_reviews.text: There was a problem with set up...I called Customer Service and spent 10 minutes with a guy trying to give me "free" stuff for $11.95 cause I was the 100th caller. I kept asking if this was D-Link's customer service and was assured that it was. I kept saying I didn't want the "free" stuff, just answers to a set up problem and he kept telling me he would get to it as soon as his computer booted the info and then continued to try to get me to take the "free" stuff. After hanging up I called back and got the same..."congratulations, you're the 100th caller, etc." Finally just returned the router to D-Link.
customer_reviews.author: Toni Mock

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Happy with D-Link DIR-655 Extreme N Router
customer_reviews.text: Deciding on the "perfect" router was a decision that I did not make lightly. I made this decision after reading as much technical info that left me more confused than informed, and then consulting with my son-in-law who is a computer wiz. He recommended this router without qualification, stating it would be a router that we would never outgrow because of its speed, features, and security. After comparing it with top-notch routers on the market, feature for feature, it was clear that the D-Link DIR-655 Extreme N suited our needs perfectly. We have not been disappointed. It was very easy to install and its performance has been flawless. The Amazon price could not be beat!
customer_reviews.author: East Coast Lady

customer_reviews.title: Extreme Performance Without Extreme Costs
customer_reviews.text: Setup was fairly easy. I could not get the setup disk to work in W7 with Spyware Doctor and MS Security Essentials, but manually going in with the IP, there were Auto Programs for Wireless and Internet setups. The Share Port feature is nice to allow other systems to access USB Devices such as a Printer or External Hard Drive. I've had a few issues of disconnect and had to reboot the router. Range and signal are fine with the triple antennas. If you want a good router and not many hassles with setup, decent tech support, D-Link is fine. I've had setup several Netgear routers, G's and N's, and this was easier to setup other than the Disk Issue.
customer_reviews.author: Mitchell A. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Worked well while it lasted...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this router from Amazon in November 2011 and it worked great right up until about two weeks ago. After a week of unplugging/replugging, calling my ISP, and putting up with dumped WiFi, I determined that the router was at fault. I gave it two stars because it worked great for almost two years, but in reality it's just another piece of disposable trash that I wish I never would have purchased. There's no guarantee that the MediaLink I'm replacing it with will last any longer, but it costs less than I paid for the DLink, so I'm willing to give it a shot.
customer_reviews.author: Jethro

customer_reviews.title: Reliable and Fast
customer_reviews.text: Ive had it for about a month now, and I find it fast and reliable. It doesnt overheat like some people say, and so far it hasnt dropped any packets (knock on wood). For WiFi-N you have to setup a more secure WPA passphrase instead of the traditional WEP. The only thing I find a bit annoying is the default d-link search hijacking feature that forces you to use d-link's search feature instead of Google. I found a way to turn this off, but havent implemented it yet (its a pain in the butt to do). If you want a good, reliable, fast WiFi Router, I recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Tamir E.

customer_reviews.title: Gaming must!!
customer_reviews.text: I did have the Lynksus wireless router that T-Mobile gave us with our land line but I was constantly having firewall problems. Tried everything. Tutorials, customer support for every company in the house(Sony, Microsoft, Comcast). I got this D Link to fix all the probs I was having with my wireless gaming network. I can and have several times, run my desktop(wired), PS3 (wireless), Xbox 360 (wireless), and laptop (wireless) all at the same time with lightening speed. That includes both PCs browsing the net and both gaming systems playing online multiplayer. Def worth the money I paid for it. Flawless wireless network. Highly recommend for gamers like me.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: D-Link Extreme EASY setup
customer_reviews.text: This D-Link 655 extreme N wireless router was very easy to connect. Once I typed in the necessary information,it was ready to go. Connecting our laptop was equally flaxless. The laptop recognized the D-Link and once I typed in the SSID # it was set. My wife now complains how fast the laptop reacts. Connecting my two TIVO's was a simple matter also. I did have to buy another Tivo brand adapter because because Tivo would not accept the netgear adapter I had been using. I'm running the D-Link with an HP Pavillion Elite m9280f which has built in 80211N. I am very pleased with this router and would definitely recommend it. R.Sease, Mesa Az
customer_reviews.author: R. SEASE

customer_reviews.title: Good unit...easy set-up
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to replace existing D-Link 2 antenna router that overheated and shut down. Easy install and set-up. Works well and runs lots cooler than the earlier D-Link unit that it replaced. The 3 antennas look very effective, actually the signal strength is identical to the earlier D-Link 2 antenna router that it replaced. Went with this model rather than the the less-durable appearing "pencil sharpner" or "vase" style that is being currently sold at most locations. It's "cloudless" but works great...and was on sale!!!
customer_reviews.author: Weatherbug

customer_reviews.title: Best Router I've Used
customer_reviews.text: This is the best router I've ever used. Its been rated highly by many of the PC/technology review sites... which is the reason I bought it in the first place. The coverage is definitely better than even the older D-Link routers, and includes a very competent QoS engine. I tweaked it just a tad, but only because I enjoy playing with things and seeing how they work. The router worked perfectly right out of the box and I was online within 5 minutes. My Fiancee's PowerBook G4 had been dropped, and the antenna was damaged. Before, she couldn't get any signals outside of 25 feet. Now, she is surfing the internet across the house, at much higher speeds than before.
customer_reviews.author: J. Tsai

customer_reviews.title: Review of D-Link DIR-655 (I know, a real original title...)
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this Wireless router for use in my New basement apartment. So far, it has performed admirably. I have not had to restart / reset the unit in over a month of operation. The Interface is relatively easy to use, and I had no issues setting up an encrypted wireless network. The Gigabit switch is a definite plus over some competing products. Overall, I am quite satisfied and would have no problems recommending this router to my friends and family.
customer_reviews.author: piclopse

customer_reviews.title: Very fast, very consistent
customer_reviews.text: Our internet provider is comcast and we live in southwest michigan. Our current plan advertises 50 mps. I installed a trendnet ac1200 dual band router first witch didn't work, something with the wifi. Since I installed this router we have been getting consistent test result of 35 mps on wifi with ping anywhere from 10-30 (that is with speedtest.com and during peak times around 5 pm). Whats even better are the test result with a ethernet connection consistenly 57mps, same ping, same time of the day. The QOS works perfectly too, I haven't experienced any connection lag while using my xbox 360 since installing this router a week ago. This router is perfect for a household that doesn't need dualband.
customer_reviews.author: QuintinandJade

customer_reviews.title: Had 2 of these routers fail in less than 6 ...
customer_reviews.text: Had 2 of these routers fail in less than 6 months. In the meantime they have to be rebooted about every 2 days.
customer_reviews.author: RG

customer_reviews.title: just what we needed
customer_reviews.text: Our Dsl company provided us with a modem that just didn't have the power needed to transmit to my laptop. We bought this with hopes that my laptop could finally be free of a cord. IT IS! We get great signal on the laptop anywhere in the house. Our Wii gets great signal and we love being able to plug our printer into the usb and print from both computers. We have it in the plastic holder that comes with and have not had any problems with overheating or bright lights like some reviews stated. While in the holder the lights actually face down so are barely visible. Overall love it!
customer_reviews.author: Sabrina

customer_reviews.title: The LEDs are to Bright...
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice affordable router without a lot of bells and whistles. For basic home networking, this router works great. I have no complaints about it's use, features, or signal strength. What I do have issues with are the LED indicators. They are bright. No, they are very bright. This is fine during the daylight hours, but at night my office has a bright blue glow that must be visible from space. I realize tape or other remedies exist, but come on I should not have to do that. Besides, what is the point of making them that bright?
customer_reviews.author: JDB

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Just received this router to replace my aging Netgear (which I really liked and have had for a long time) but I was having issues with streaming video (Netflix etc.) and high bandwidth applications. I figured it was time to upgrade to wireless N and gigabit LAN. Installation was a breeze and everything was working within 30 minutes. I also replaced my aging ethernet switch to gigabit (dlink as well). I am getting excellent performance, even my typical internet surfing is greatly improved. I am not having the heat issues (the unit being very warm) as mentioned but the blue lights are really bright. So far, so good.
customer_reviews.author: freddg

customer_reviews.title: Gigabit versus Linksys G
customer_reviews.text: I bought this router to increase the range and speed at my office. The Linksys wireless G router I had was always very low in terms of signal strenth. The Gigabit router is about 6x (as advertised) better in my particular circumstances. That means I get a low signal instead of a very low. On the downside, it's about $40 more than the Linksys. Moreover, the setup required a call to tech support to configure the wireless properly, which the tech rep said was common. The tech support was very good, very fast. The Linksys setup was a snap (as advertised) and worked perfectly out of the box. It's just that the range and speed weren't as good.
customer_reviews.author: MkLt

customer_reviews.title: D Link DIR-655
customer_reviews.text: We received this item last Friday & I put off installing until today as I remembered how difficult the last D Link 614+ was to install years ago. My how times have changed, for the better ! With my trusty assistant by my side, we were finished the install in no time at all. What a pleasure it was. So far the 655 is preforming as it was designed. But, we are looking for the specific info on how to use the USB port for printer sharing & have not found anything yet. Will look more later as we have had enough mental exercise for one day. Buy it, install it & you will love it !!
customer_reviews.author: M. A. French

customer_reviews.title: Great Customer Service from Mylene I.D # AR004212 Case # C6679871 at D-Link Tech Support.
customer_reviews.text: I initially connected my DIR-655 wireless router to a WiFi connection hoping it would solve my slow internet problem. After the connection I was still experiencing a slow internet. My ISP provider came and changed out my Modem but could not get me connected back to WiFi. Their excuse was that maybe the router was not compatible with their new modem and he suggested I use theirs (of course for a monthly fee) and he left my house not being able to connect to a WiFi. They were wrong and Mylene was super fast on getting my WiFi up and going again. Glad she works tech support at D-Link.
customer_reviews.author: John McCormack

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in Nov 2012 and two years later has been running without a hitch. No complaints!! EDIT: It's now March 2016 and this router is still running like a champ. I honestly don't think I've ever had a single issue with it. EDIT EDIT: Here we are, July 2018, and this router finally bit the dust. Something inside fried (and the power jack melted) and so I had to lay this bad boy to rest. This router lasted for 6 years and I never had a single problem with it. Definitely got my money's worth. Rest in peace...
customer_reviews.author: AriTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: this seemed the perfect fit. Installation was a breeze except for my ...
customer_reviews.text: This router replaces my linksys n300 which, after 7 years, finally gave me enough headaches to say goodbye. Not seeing the need to purchase a product with technology which may have exceeded what I need, this seemed the perfect fit. Installation was a breeze except for my security settings which I already had problems with in network settings on my PC. When I contacted the D-Link tech support (C6554104/AR004211) all of my problems were easily solved with the fabulous support of their rep. Wait time on the phone was so fast that I was almost shocked! All was up and running in no time flat and I am smoothly streaming and surfing problem free. Thanks D-Link!
customer_reviews.author: Stevielynn

customer_reviews.title: D-Link very easy to setup.
customer_reviews.text: I have always found D-Link very easy to setup and better then other units at twice the price. My Comcast business account is set for 16 Mds but with this D-Link wireless router my wire lan/wan is running at 19.78+ Mbs! My video streaming has for the most part stopped lagging. This is a GREAT WAN & LAN router!
customer_reviews.author: Larry Larsen

customer_reviews.title: The router chokes
customer_reviews.text: I bought this router to replace my old Linksys. The wireless works fine is there is only one user using it, but it chokes on my family data. I have three computers, two iPads, and 2 iPhones. When everyone is on the internet at the same time the connections drop, it is obnoxious. My computers also tell me there is an IP conflict, but I can never find the duplicate IP. If you want to use a lot of wireless devices at the same time I would buy a different router.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff98

customer_reviews.title: FANTASTIC router for the price.  What more can I say?
customer_reviews.text: I've installed nearly 20 of these in various locations. They are a WONDERFUL router, especially for the price. Many user controls, programming is a snap (you can use the Wizard software but don't really need to), and features are wonderfully variable and controllable. The units are durable; I've encountered only one failure ever and I think someone dropped that one. Range is great, speed is excellent, many security features and options. Easily configurable to anything parameters you like. You will not go wrong with this router.
customer_reviews.author: AntennaMan

customer_reviews.title: I got 3 years out of it!
customer_reviews.text: This router worked great without failure for three straight years. Now all of the sudden I am losing internet connections and slow downloads. I plugged the cable directly from modem to computer and everything was fast again so I know that this router is now slowing me down and time to replace. I have not researched new ones yet but maybe I should just replace with the same model? 3 years was better than my previous link system for about the same money Any suggestions?
customer_reviews.author: Ric

customer_reviews.title: Nice router
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice unit. Easy to setup, enough options to satisfy everyone. Improvements over previous D-Link units include better user interface, better support for peer-to-peer networking. I have two wired Macs, two wireless PC's, one wireless Mac, an airport express, a Brother laser printer on the network and they all play well with this unit and with each other. Gigabit switch is fast, mixed N and G wireless works well. A lot of router for the price. Good buy. The blue LED's are wicked bright - you are going to want to put this in a closet or wherever it won't give you a seizure or keep you up at night.
customer_reviews.author: jfb

customer_reviews.title: Great router
customer_reviews.text: This is my second D-Link router, the first one (wireless-G) worked flawlessly for over 2 years. Bought this model to upgrade to wireless-N. The setup was easy, be sure to disable any firewall software on your computer that can block certain ports. I have 2 computers connected directly to the router via Wi-Fi, plus a Wi-Fi enabled iPod touch, plus a Wi-Fi enabled Blu-Ray player. I also have a D-Link wireless bridge/access point device connected to the router and two more computers connected to that device via Ethernet along with two VoIP adapters. And it all works without a hitch! This is a good, solid product.
customer_reviews.author: ASL

customer_reviews.title: Long time D-Link fan
customer_reviews.text: I've been a fan of D-Link equipment for a long time. And this router does not disappoint. It works perfectly for what it's meant to do. The reason I give it 4 stars instead of 5 is because they do try to make it do too much. Home routers, even for the tech savvy, really don't need a lot of options in the admin interface. They try to compensate by providing the installation wizard but many of the options could simply be eliminated as many of them are just other ways of setting firewall rules which you should only really play with if you know what you're doing in the first place.
customer_reviews.author: R. Yetter

customer_reviews.title: Was Hoping for No Dropped Connections - Success!
customer_reviews.text: Been using it for about two weeks now. In the first week, I had to restart the router 3 times. I replaced my Belkin G hoping to alleviate the dropped connection issue. UPDATE: Not getting dropped connections anymore. Called support and we changed settings (see comments). If you are not wireless router savvy (I am not) you may need to call DLink support as I did to optimize the settings. I have a MacBook Pro and the DLink auto-setup is not available in that case. So you have to login to the router and manually do the settings. I was able to set it up but I was not certain I had done it right.
customer_reviews.author: K.F.

customer_reviews.title: lasting quality is not there
customer_reviews.text: I have had this router for about a year. It worked fine with no issues until recently. It started needing a reboot almost every day. I made no changes to my computer or added any new devices. Not sure why it stopped working. It did not overheat. I tried changing router settings and even updated the firmware. No luck, the router is garbage. I had to buy a new one. I gave it three stars because it worked fine for a year.
customer_reviews.author: Adam H.

customer_reviews.title: A solid wireless router you can depend on!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this wireless router for several years now and have not been disappointed! It just works, day after day, year after year. There are three laptops that share this router and there have been no problems at all (with AT&T service, well.....). You will likely not go wrong with this product. I recommend it highly!
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Bell

customer_reviews.title: Excellent router
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a 10 year old Netgear wireless router that was failing. I have been impressed by the ease of the setup, and the range and power of the wireless signal. My old router did not cover the entire house, this router covers it all and extends into the back and front yards as well. From a performance standpoint, I see improved throughput passing packets through to the internet compared to my older router. This is not wireless performance, since 802.11N is faster than 802.11G by design... but is rather an indication of the packet switching performance of the router itself. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: C. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: D-Link ends promised lifetime DNS service
customer_reviews.text: The reason I bought this router was for the lifetime DNS service. They ended with almost no notice on July 2nd.
customer_reviews.author: H A.

customer_reviews.title: Both 2. 4 GHz & 5. 0 GHz ...
customer_reviews.text: Both 2.4 GHz & 5.0 GHz signals. Getting up to 200 Mbs throughput.
customer_reviews.author: N0HEQ

customer_reviews.title: D-Link Router is still doing great
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased 2 different routers from a different brand that didn't last more than 3 months before they stopped working. This router is heaven sent. Works well. Provides the much needed wireless coverage in our home. It is a sleek design and can be placed on its side with the included stand. I am very happy that this router has worked out so well. If I ever have someone ask me to recommend a wireless router I will have to recommend this one. No doubt!!
customer_reviews.author: Luz Tufer

customer_reviews.title: A Fine Choice for a Router
customer_reviews.text: The D-Link DIR-655 Extreme N wireless router was just what we had hoped for after reading other reviews. It was easy to set up to replace our two-year old G router from D-Link, and now our connectivity is much stronger throughout the house. The laptop works just fine even in the backyard about 80 feet from the router. No failures to connect and no dropped signals any longer. So far there has been no need to reset the router or contact customer support. The improvement was very noticeable even with the one-year old laptop that has a G-rated wireless card. So there is no question that the router is backward compatible.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Kraft

customer_reviews.title: EASY AND FAST DOWNLOAD SPEED
customer_reviews.text: We live in a terrible location for internet. Nope not the country, or mountains, right in the middle of a very well developed area in Arizona. My son and daughter-in-law had terrible reception. After researching the product I got it for them for Christmas. Works really good for them, they live near us so their reception was bad as well. They are as happy as they can be with this, and I would recommend it to others. Easy to hook up, and great speed.
customer_reviews.author: Scottie

customer_reviews.title: Full Bars
customer_reviews.text: My former router was D-link as well so setting it up was pretty easy for me. I now have much better coverage in the condo on y tablet, laptops, and cell phones. Even in the areas where coverage dropped previously I tend to keep full bars. Videos on Amazon Prime, Hulu, Netflix and Vudu all play much better and with fewer skips and jumps. Another side benefit is with my Republic Wireless cell service, the call quality was improved and no longer do I have the echo effect. Watching videos on the Kindle are also much better now.
customer_reviews.author: Chris St Pierre

customer_reviews.title: Rock Solid Performer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a Belkin router that seemed to occasionally be the cause of network glitches. I'm glad I did. My network has 7 devices hardwired to the router (with gigabit switches). I use a wireless laser printer, 2 Kindles and a smartphone, and whatever gadgets guests bring with them. In months of operation, I couldn't point to any network problems that were the fault of the router. The Wireless N works perfectly everywhere in my house.
customer_reviews.author: Big Ed

customer_reviews.title: Works great and does what you expect
customer_reviews.text: the signal is definitely strong and reliable. I have many wireless in the area and I haven't had any drop or lose of signal. I did have occasionally some of those issues with the previous model DIR-615. If you have FIOS it will not work in AUTO mode (10/100/1000) out of the box and mostly it's a Verizon issue. I had to deal for a few days on the phone to convince Verizon that the issue was on their side and internet is full of people reporting the same issue. That's the only mini snafu that I noticed for everything else it's a good unit and I'm happy about it.
customer_reviews.author: Esposito Mario

customer_reviews.title: AAA+ Router
customer_reviews.text: I have had this router for over a month and have had "0" drop outs in that time. The range is not all that great, but is probably due to the configuration of my home.I cant seem to get more than 2 bars whereas my clunky blue Linksys gave me a consistent 3 bars. I purchased and installed the Amped 150 repeater and now can get full bars on my laptop across the street. However,the Amped installs as another network but the range is fantastic. Iam very pleased with this router as it has given me no problems except for the poor range.
customer_reviews.author: JUST-JIM

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware...
customer_reviews.text: I just received this router in July 2020. Have not been able to use my wireless service successfully in two days so I called technical support. Seems this item was discontinued in 2018 and is not eligible for technical support. So in order to get this piece of garbage to work I would have to pay. It’s going back today!
customer_reviews.author: Debbie

customer_reviews.title: Performs well
customer_reviews.text: After trying to get different linksys working, this one works with no problems at all. One of the previous issues that I was being able to support large amounts of bandwidth through the previous routers. This router works without any issues. There are a lot of configuration options for the device which makes the device configurable. I have had this device for a while now and I haven't had to reboot it once. I have been very happy with the device and would buy another one without giving it another thought. This is the one to get if you are looking for a device with good range and configuration options.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent P. Bedus

customer_reviews.title: Issues with internet connectivity after 1 yr
customer_reviews.text: After about 1 yr of use, 2 of these degraded producing consistent internet connectivity issues multiple times per hour on all of our wireless clients including 3 OnePlus One mobile phones, 1 Sony Xperia Z mobile phone, Dell laptop, 2 HP laptops, 3 Samsung Google Nexus phones, 1 Samsung Google Nexus Tablet, 1 Samsung Chromebook, and various USB wireless adapters. We replaced our 2 D-Link APs with one Ubiquiti UniFi AP, and that solved all of our connectivity issues.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: D-Link Wireless N+300 Mbps Extreme-N Gigabit Router (DIR-655)
customer_reviews.text: Wow, I have had this one in service since 2010 and it never gets noticed. It is very fast and powerful on the wireless side and is simple to set up the security. Had it working in minutes and it hasn't stopped since. I am a fan of D-link for several years now. The older model was beginning to choke a little and was not IPV 6 capable so I bought this one and haven't had a fret since. As the new IPV6 becomes the mainstay I plan to keep on going with this one till it dies from heat or something like that.
customer_reviews.author: Papanoc

customer_reviews.title: Awesome QoS! Able to play streaming video and not get kicked off of XBOX LIVE!
customer_reviews.text: I first got the D-Link DGL-4100 but that didn't seem to resolve my issues of getting kicked off of XBOX LIVE whenever my wife would stream videos. It seemed that whenever a video was steaming I couldn't even connect! I then returned that D-Link DGL-4100 and got this one. Ran through the initial disk setup with the defaults and am able to d/l 400 kbps torrents or stream video without getting kicked from XBOX LIVE! Awesome! I'm glad I picked up this router and I got it for around $85 shipped. Also am glad that I didn't spend double the money to get one of the higher priced gaming routers.
customer_reviews.author: electronicnut

customer_reviews.title: Great wireless router
customer_reviews.text: Great, affordable router with easy web based setup and great wireless range. The USB Shareport is a great bonus and it works with a USB hub (powered) for multiple devices. Each device can only be accessed by one computer at a time but individual devices can be accessed by separate computers at the same time, so one computer can be printing while another is accessing a USB drive, etc. Make sure you download the latest version of the Shareport utility software (3.0), it didn't come on the included CD. Better yet try Silex Technology's SX Virtual Link software.
customer_reviews.author: bmacki

customer_reviews.title: Seems to crap out on me occationally once the family starts using ...
customer_reviews.text: Seems to crap out on me occationally once the family starts using wifi heavily. Tried updating to the latest firmware didn't seem to help. The wifi crashes but seems to restart itself most of the time. If its just me on the wifi it seems to work fine, add 3 other family members and it has trouble. May be a bad router or something though. Ended up buying a replacement, different dlink model, and things are much better...
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Trouble
customer_reviews.text: At first i thought we would like this. But we have had nothing but trouble. It was easy to set up and install and had no problems till be bought 2 new laptops. They would not stay connected and when we tried to reboot them they would grab the IP add of the main pc and shut the whole network down. I even called dell (laptops) and then call D link and NO ONE could help fix the issue. I have as of 3 months ago replaced this router with another router (Asus).
customer_reviews.author: James Hobbs

customer_reviews.title: Great performance and features
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a Belkin Pre-N router. The Belkin generally worked well and had excellent range, but suffered from some random lockups requiring a reboot now and then, and its firmware didn't have a some of the site blocking and port forwarding features I wanted. The D-Link DIR-655 has been rock-solid and the firmware options are vastly more comprehensive than the Belkin Pre-N. Range is very slightly less than the Belkin, but still very good; the furthest machine is about 150ft away and downstairs, but even through several walls and the floor it still gets an acceptable signal.
customer_reviews.author: Scott W

customer_reviews.title: GREAT UNIT
customer_reviews.text: I have a network of macs and windows pcs and had problems setting up a Net Gear wireless router. So I read some reviews and opted for this D-Link unit. It connected in seconds, the interface was very intuitive and user friendly, setting up security and my various computers was a breeze and its range and power surpasses my previous Linksys router, which performed well with my hardwired computers but lost connectivity many times for all my wireless laptops. Furthermore it was an outdated wireless-B unit. Therefore, I am very pleased with this router and highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: RDS

customer_reviews.title: Great Router!
customer_reviews.text: This router is worth every penny. I have always had success with D-Link routers. I purchased the DIR-655 to replace another D-Link wireless router that I used daily for almost 4 years before it unfortunately ceased to work correctly anymore. I have not had any issues with this router and I am able to wirelessly link multiple computers and other devices like a Sony PSP with great internet surfing speed. I only wish my cable modem and internet provider could broadcast at a higher rate of speed (100 Mbps)because it is clear that this router could handle it. I highly recommend this product to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Fast connection, long range!
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a wireless guru. So I don't know all the fancy terminology. I do know that my past two wireless routers kept dropping out at random times. Since they were my first two wireless routers, I thought it was just a normal aspect of being a wireless router user. Well, it's not! This router has not dropped out at all and its range is amazing. I can use the WiFi on my iPhone when I'm outside at our apartment's playground, which is at least 1000 feet away. The router was easy to get set up and even had a wizard to help you through it, if you need it. All in all, a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan J. Mulholland

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous!
customer_reviews.text: This product replaced a Netgear WGR-614v1. Compared to the Netgear, the wireless range is significantly further, and I get 75% signal strength on my MacBook throughout the house now (vs. 25% before). 802.11n is significantly faster than 802.11g, and of course the upgraded WPA security is better than WEP. I disabled traffic shaping 'cos I don't play networked games, so I have no opinion on that. The Gigabit hub works well, and I get 400Mbps transfers between computers (4x faster than 100Mbps), probably limited by the hard drive. Excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: I. Chan

customer_reviews.title: Decent home router
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this MIMO router for the following benefits over my previous Linksys router. It should provide better performance, MIMO (Multiple-Input/Multiple-Output), Gigabit interface and a built-in usb drive. I gave three stars because it works well when everything is fine. However, whenever you try to update the setting on the router, it would reboot itself for the update to take effect. It usually takes 20 seconds to 90 seconds, in various tasks such as updating the policy, schedule to a simple admin user password.
customer_reviews.author: Hidden Dragon

customer_reviews.title: Just got it, up and running
customer_reviews.text: Replaced my DLINK DI634 with this. 10-20 seconds to acquire wells fargo account or amazon reduced to 1-2 seconds. Same greatly increased speed for msn and email. also, communication between my two shop computers was almost unbelievable after the change. SUGGESTION: WRITE DOWN AND KEEP !!!! where you can find them again (I had done this) all the user names and passwords especially those from your ISP And the settings used in the previious setup. It still took several hours to get all the lights on and msn up and running. Expected I'd be slow.
customer_reviews.author: RM GRAPHICS

customer_reviews.title: A Great Improvement
customer_reviews.text: I recently installed this D-Link router in my home. We were having problems with our three year old "g" router and we had to try something new. Someone with much more expertise than I have recommended an N router and it really has done the trick. Set up was a bit complicated, but not impossible. The signal is much, much stronger than it had been in the house. The signal does not suddenly "drop off" when you get farther away from the source. Overall, I am very happy. My entire family has noticed the improvement--from itouch users to internet radio users. It was worth the expense.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Hendry

customer_reviews.title: This router works, but it's not a magic bullet.
customer_reviews.text: I needed a router with gigabit wired ethernet and figured that wireless would be a good idea as well. It's easy to set-up. It also has a nice "guest" password so that visitors who bring their laptops and want access to your wireless internet connection do not get access to your whole network. The 802.11N seems a bit better than my 802.11G was, but I still have issues with wireless coverage. The antennas are detachable, so I may be able to put on some directional antennas to increase my range. I'm not unhappy with my purchase, but it didn't exceed my expectations either. No surprises, so I guess that's a good thing.
customer_reviews.author: TL

customer_reviews.title: Work's great and was easy to install.
customer_reviews.text: Installation could not have been any easier and it works reliably with no disconnects. I located this in the center of a large home and I get a good download speed now everywhere within the home. I found a central location was critical in maximizing coverage and download speed. Also, slight changes can make a difference, especially if you are locating it near a wall. Beware though of D-Link's tech support should you encounter a problem. Unfortunately you are talking to people who seem to just have the manuals in front of them and not much more knowledge.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Fan

customer_reviews.title: worthless product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this router to extend the range of the wireless network within my house. It was a failure. The range was no greater than that of my old router. In addition, it frequently dropped the wireless connection while the wired connection remained good. The wireless connection could only be restored by rebooting the router. I sent it back and obtained another identical router. It had identical problems. Possibly Amazon had a defective batch of these routers. They were highly recommended by the person who set up my network.
customer_reviews.author: bad dog

customer_reviews.title: No Problems, Easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: I'm an old computer professional but this is my first wireless router. This router explained the basics so I could properly set it up with the wizard without having to learn everything there is to know about wireless technology. I haven't had to restart it once since I first brought it online. There are lots of features, most of which I will never use, but they are there if I ever need them. This is my third D-Link product and I haven't had one issue with any of them. In contrast, the Netgear wired router I had was unreliable. I'm buying D-Link from now on.
customer_reviews.author: DFS

customer_reviews.title: Sony Vaio's beware
customer_reviews.text: Not so fast partner... although most of the other devices on my network will function fine on this router... the most expensive device I have ever purchased, Sony Vaio Duo 11 ( love it ) has issues with this router and neither company has fixes for it...(sony wifi update has settled some of the problems but I still have to reboot both devices sometimes) it does have good distance response all of my house is covered with just this router instead of me having to have a repeater on one side of the house
customer_reviews.author: 3DFreek

customer_reviews.title: Great router upgrade
customer_reviews.text: Great replacement for my failing wireless router. I have not gotten too into the nitty gritty regarding shareport or advanced setups, but it spits that magical wireless signal to my devices without issue. Easy to setup out of the box. Easy to use setup web page to check and alter settings. Upgrading the firmware unfortunately lost most of my settings, which was more of a hassle than an issue as I had fully set everything up prior to updating the firmware. No issues with wireless or wired connections in about a month of use now.
customer_reviews.author: NickisratingstuffonAmazon

customer_reviews.title: An excellent choice, easy to setup, and the USB SharePort is great!
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to setup, but you need to know your connection type. Call your ISP and ask (or Google it), it makes the process easier. The included software says connect the modem to the router but connect the computer and the modem at the same time, it makes your job easier. After you're setup and your router doesn't meltdown your internet should be running smoothly. Be sure to install SharePort from the CD to make use of your included USB port on the back of the router! (You'll have to install the program on whatever computer you'll want to use the device via SharePort on.)
customer_reviews.author: Top 10 Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: good router but ran its course
customer_reviews.text: I had this router for about 3 years - it worked well but it is time for a change - the connectivity keeps dropping when many devices are connected - the new Kindle Fire HDX does has shoddy connection with this router (Older router tech). It was a good performer and if it was 3 years ago i would buy again but need to upgrade to newer wifi router for multiple devices and up to date tech with out having wifi drops.
customer_reviews.author: apopnj

customer_reviews.title: Everything about it was great, then it died
customer_reviews.text: Everything about this router was great. Performance, size, setup. The menus are really easy to use. Has a great form-factor. Then after 3 months of use being solid as a rock, it locked up once needing to be rebooted - then a day later, it went totally bonkers. I sent it back to Amazon (returns after 30 days are not very simple) and got a Netgear N900 - better, but costs over twice as much. Was mine just a lemon or does this line have a high failure rate? Who knows. The DIR-655 a great value if you can get it to hang with you.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Buy a different router.  I don't care how good of deal this seems like
customer_reviews.text: I have owned several routers for home and work. I have setup countless routers for friends and family. After I could not get this router to hold an internet connection, I called DLink tech support. I spent two hours on the phone with them only for them to say, "It sounds like its a hardware problem and I should get a replacement unit." I asked how often this happens and she said, "Quite often." Yikes. Just spend the extra couple bucks and get a Linksys/Cisco.
customer_reviews.author: J. Grobaski

customer_reviews.title: D-Link DIR655 does not disappoint!
customer_reviews.text: I've been Buying D-Link products for a long time. This is actually the second DIR-655 that I have purchased. Bought one for my Son In Law to use in his new place and was so impressed with the speed and range, that I bought one for my new place. Easy to setup, great feature set (especially the gigabit ports), and outstanding range are good features, but the speed of the 802.11N wireless is awesome. Even my television likes it, connecting to Netflix and downloading instant shows is almost too easy.I would strongly recommend this router.
customer_reviews.author: Herb

product_meta.title: D-Link Wireless N300 Mbps Extreme-N Gigabit Router (DIR-655)
product_meta.description:
The D-Link Extreme-N Gigabit Router (DIR-655) is a draft 2.0 802.11n compliant device that delivers up to 14x faster speeds and 6x farther range than 802.11g while staying backward compatible with 802.11g devices. Connect the Extreme-N Gigabit Router to a cable or DSL modem and provide high-speed Internet access to multiple computers, game consoles, and media players. Create a secure wireless network to share photos, files, music, videos, printers, and network storage.

AMAZON.COM
feature_bullets: Delivers up to 14x faster speeds* and 6x farther range* than 80211g means greater coverage for your entire home or office
Ideal for streaming HD video or streaming multiple applications simultaneously
Intelligent QoS technology prioritizes both wired and wireless Internet traffic to enable enhanced gaming and phone calling (VoIP) experience
Gigabit Ports for Incredible Wired Network Speeds
Dual active firewall protection (SPI & NAT) helps block malicious attacks on networks from the Internet
